holidays.name: Best Friends Day
holidays.description: A heartfelt day dedicated to celebrating the cherished bond of best friends. It’s the perfect excuse to reach out, reminisce, and maybe even plan a quirky adventure together!
holidays.origin: While the exact origin is unclear, Best Friends Day has been celebrated unofficially since the early 2000s and has grown in popularity thanks to social media.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that having a best friend can improve longevity and reduce stress—so celebrate wisely!

holidays.name: World Oceans Day
holidays.description: An international day to honor and raise awareness about the vast and vital oceans that cover most of our planet.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 1992 during the Earth Summit in Rio de Janeiro.
holidays.funFact: Over 80% of the ocean remains unexplored—almost like an alien universe right here on Earth!

holidays.name: Hug Your Cat Day
holidays.description: A quirky celebration encouraging cat lovers to give their feline friends extra snuggles and love today—if your cat permits, that is.
holidays.origin: An unofficial internet holiday that gained traction through social media cat fan clubs around 2010.
holidays.funFact: Cats generally don’t love hugs, so if your kitty cooperates, you’re definitely their favorite human!

holidays.name: National Vichyssoise Day
holidays.description: A day to savor and celebrate vichyssoise—a smooth, creamy cold potato and leek soup that’s fancy enough for summer parties.
holidays.origin: Named after the classic French-American chef Louis Diat who popularized the dish in the early 20th century.
holidays.funFact: Vichyssoise is traditionally served cold, but some daring chefs like to stir things up by serving it warm!
